ENT110.name: Applied Entomology of Economic Plants
ENT110.description: Arthropod pests of horticultural plants and turf grasses. Groups and species of economic importance to Michigan.
ENT110.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

ENT111.name: Basics of Applied Entomology
ENT111.description: Basic insect biology, principles of integrated pest management, and the major pests of field crops, woody ornamentals, other perennials, turf, and commercial greenhouses. Offered first ten weeks of semester.
ENT111.restrictions: Open to students in the Institute of Agricultural Technology.

ENT205.name: Pests, Society and Environment
ENT205.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ENT205.description: Nature of pests and their impact on society. Principles of integrated pest management in relation to environmental quality and sustainable development.

ENT264.name: Turfgrass Entomology
ENT264.description: Life history, identification, and collection of turfgrass insects. Cultural, biological and insecticide control. Principles of pest management.

ENT319.name: Introduction to Earth System Science
ENT319.description: Systems approach to Earth as an integration of geochemical, geophysical, biological and social components. Global dynamics at a variety of spatio-temporal scales. Sustainability of the Earth system.

ENT401.name: Directed Studies
ENT401.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ENT401.description: Individual field or laboratory research, or review of published literature, on a topic of interest.

ENT404.name: Fundamentals of Entomology
ENT404.description: Insect classification, identification, diversity, physiology and ecology. Importance of insects to humans and the environment. Insect collection required.

ENT407.name: Diseases and Insects of Forest and Shade Trees
ENT407.description: Diseases, insects, and environmental problems affecting trees in forests, parks, suburbs, and nurseries. Methods of control.
ENT407.prerequisite: (PLB 105 or BS 162 or LB 144) and Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

ENT410.name: Apiculture and Pollination
ENT410.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ENT410.description: Biology of bees and their relationship to flowers, pollination and crop production. Offered first ten weeks of semester. Laboratory sessions at MSU apiary.

ENT422.name: Aquatic Entomology
ENT422.description: Biology, ecology and systematics of aquatic insects in streams, rivers and lakes. Field trips and aquatic insect collection required.

ENT451.name: Insect Physiology
ENT451.description: Structure/function of insect physiological systems. Molecular mechanisms underlying insect development. Physiological evolution in insects.

ENT460.name: Medical Entomology
ENT460.description: Transmission and management of infectious diseases involving insects and acarines.
ENT460.prerequisite: ENT 404 or MMG 201 or MMG 301 or approval of department
ENT460.restrictions: Open to juniors and open to seniors and open to graduate students.

ENT461.name: Field Ecology of Disease Vectors
ENT461.description: Collection and identification of arthropod vectors of human and animal diseases in Michigan. Assays for associated pathogens. Integration of disease ecology and public health responses to vector-borne disease

ENT477.name: Pesticides in Pest Management
ENT477.description: Chemistry, modes of action, product development and regulation of pesticides. Environmental and social aspects of pesticide use.
ENT477.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students.

ENT479.name: Organic Pest Management (W)
ENT479.description: Theory, philosophy and application of organic pest management systems. Field trips required.
ENT479.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
ENT479.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or graduate students or approval of department.

ENT802.name: Nature and Practice of Science
ENT802.description: Exploration of the nature of the scientific endeavor and how individual scientists can become more successful in its practice.
ENT802.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Agriculture and Natural Resources and open to graduate students in the College of Natural Science or approval of department.

ENT812.name: Graduate Seminar
ENT812.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
ENT812.description: Current research topics. Student presentation required.

ENT815.name: Insect Behavior
ENT815.description: Fundamentals of insect behavior with emphasis on mechanisms. Quantitative methods.

ENT818.name: Adult Insect Taxonomy
ENT818.description: Identification, morphology, biology and evolutionary relationships of adult insects. Insect collection required.

ENT830.name: Statistical Methods in Ecology and Evolution I
ENT830.description: Fundamental elements of data analysis in ecology and evolution. Programming fundamentals in the R computing language. Introduction to modeling biological data with modern methods for estimation and inference.
ENT830.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Entomology or in the Ecology, Evolutionary Biology and Behavior Specialization or in the Ecology, Evolutionary Biology and Behavior Major or approval of department.

ENT831.name: Statistical Methods in Ecology and Evolution II
ENT831.description: Advanced interpretation and modeling of biological data with modern methods for estimation and inference using the R computing language.
ENT831.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Department of Entomology or in the Ecology, Evolutionary Biology and Behavior Specialization or in the Ecology, Evolutionary Biology and Behavior Major or approval of department.

ENT838.name: Immature Insect Taxonomy
ENT838.description: Classification, identification, morphology, biology and evolutionary relationships of immature insects. Emphasis on terrestrial holometabola. Collection required.

ENT848.name: Biological Control of Insects and Weeds
ENT848.description: Principles and practices in the application of natural enemies to control arthropod and weed pests. Identification and biology of beneficial species (parasitoids, predators, pathogens) and the ecological basis for their use in pest management systems.

ENT851.name: Insect Physiology and Molecular Biology
ENT851.description: Structure and function of physiological systems in insects, and current understanding of how these systems work at the molecular level.

ENT890.name: Independent Study
ENT890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ENT890.description: Individual study on a field or laboratory research topic or review of published literature on a topic of interest.

ENT898.name: Master's Research
ENT898.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ENT898.description: Master's degree Plan B research paper.
ENT898.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the Department of Entomology.

ENT899.name: Master's Thesis Research
ENT899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ENT899.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the Department of Entomology.

ENT999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
ENT999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
